div.p: 10 days ago
Please check frequently for notices and updates
To The Parents/Guardians of Senior Students:

p.span: I truly am sad to have to be writing this letter about an alternative graduation as a result of the COVID-19 outbreak. But I am also hopeful that this will be a graduation for you to remember! You will be the first class that does not have to go through graduation practice! Once the cap and gowns have arrived, we will set up a time for you to come and get the following items: cap and gown, senior athletic poster, FBLA, FFA, NHS chords. At graduation, you will receive your diploma, academic awards, athletic awards and any scholarships that you received.

The alternative graduation ceremony will be a car parade route through town ending up at the high school for seniors to receive their diploma. This alternative plan is due to the existence of the social distancing orders.

div.p: · May 12th is your last day! At this point, we do not know what senior checkout will look like but will get that information out at a later date.

· Students need to be at Babcock Park by 5:30 pm on Friday, May 15, 2020! Two cars per graduate. Staff members will assist you in the correct area to park: expect a little wait time at the top of Babcock Park. The car “tickets” that you will receive when you pick up your cap and gown need to be placed in the driver side dash. Graduates – please sit in the front passenger side of your vehicle. You will receive a graduation program when you enter Babcock Park – 2 programs per car.
· Decorate your car as you would like, appropriately, please. Miss J. is trying to order college pennants so you can attach those to your car.
· Graduation begins at 6:30 pm on Friday, May 15, 2020, with a parade route through town. We are starting early because we will have no lighting in the parking lot once the sun goes down.

· We are currently working with the radio to have graduation broadcasted. If the radio comes through, we will have the Salutatorian and Valedictorian speeches. If the radio is not an option – we will pre-record the speeches on YouTube or possibly do Facebook live prior to graduation for these speeches.
· Mrs. Mameda will record her speech on YouTube and we will share that link out.
· Mrs. Brusuelas will record the graduation ceremony via Facebook live on the district Facebook page.

· The parade route looks like this: exit Babcock Park and go east on Washington, turn north on 2nd street and continue to Walnut, at Walnut turn east until Main Street, at Main Street turn south until Washington, at Washington turn west and proceed to the west end of the parking lot. In the parking lot, you will enter a winding route through the parking lot. A staff member will stop you just prior to the parent pickup loop. Your two cars will pull through to the podium where your name and bio will be read. Mrs. Ridennoure will then put your diploma and other awards on a cart and roll them to your window for you to pick up. Cars will then exit out in front of the main office building area. Cars may then proceed back down Main Street. Spectators will be allowed to be on the parade route, honoring social distancing, of course. Feel free to honk after the name of each graduate is announced.
· If you have attendance hours to complete – they must be completed by May 14th.
· Prom has been rescheduled for 7.11.20 from 8-11 pm at the Gobin Building provided that the social distancing order has been lifted. If not – we will look to reschedule at a later date.

p.b: Class Cheer: We are the seniors like no class has been, we are the class of 10+10
Class Song: Don’t Blink - Kenny Chesney
Class Quote: Take pride in how far you’ve come. Have faith in
how far you can go. But don’t forget to enjoy the journey - Michael Josephson

div.p: Cindy L. Cowan

Paul Arellano will be available at graduation to take photos of your son/daughter. You will receive a disc with 3-5 pictures for $15.00. You will have rights of the photos on the disc for printing purposes. If you are interested in this service – please send the form below and payment to Kari Kienitz by 5.6.20. Paul will bring the discs to the school and we will contact you when they are ready. See you at graduation on May 15th at 6:30 pm, RFJSHS.
___Yes, I would like a photo disc of my son/daughter from the 2020 RFHS Graduation Ceremony.
Please make checks payable to Arellano Photography.

p.b: Students will graduate, be productive citizens and be college, career or military ready.

div.p: News from RFJSHS:

We are on day 3 of E-Learning and we are impressed with how things are moving along rather smoothly. Chromebook tech issues were tough yesterday but we got the problem solved. If your child is still having the privacy error issues, have them email their teacher and they can give them the directions on how to fix it.

I have a zoom meeting with senior student council members on Thursday – 4.2.20 – to discuss alternatives to graduation. Seniors can reach out to Cameron, Ricardo, Emilio or Elias to share your thoughts and ideas about graduation. If school continues to be closed, we want to ensure that graduation, in whatever form, will still occur.

Student Council has coordinated a spirit week with schools up and down the valley for K-12 students. Please look on our facebook page and on the website for flyers with the information. What a fun way to get students involved during this time.
No news at this time for any further school closures beyond April 17th. We will wait for the governor’s directives and share those out as soon as we know.
Miss J. has created google classrooms for each grade level, 7-11, for pre-registration of classes for next year. Look for a parent text with information on how to access this.

Athletes: Just a reminder that completing your work is still required so you can be eligible for athletic participation in the fall. CHSAA statement: we are all on hold awaiting the decisions of the state, health and educational entities in the next weeks. No Association decisions regarding spring activity/athletic resuming or cancellations will be made before April 13th unless decisions are made at the state level.

Thank you in advance for encouraging your child to stay engaged with his/her work so that credits can still be awarded. There is a possibility that if your child does not do the work, he/she could be required to attend school in June to make up for the time that was missed because of not completing work.
The office is open from 8-4 M-TH if you have questions – 254.7431. You can also email me at cindy.cowan@rockyford.k12.co.us
Go Meloneers!

RFJSHS can work at the public library from 1-3 pm M-F in the conference room. This opportunity is available for students who do not have access to internet at home. 10 students will be allowed in the conference room at a time. No tutoring will occur. This is simply a place for students to access the internet and work on your assignments for E-Learning Days. This will be a first come, first served basis. Enter through the north door.

The RFJSHS Library will be open today 3/25 and tomorrow 3/26 from 10:00 am to 12 pm for students to check out books. The school will comply with social distance requirements, gathering limits, and safe handling procedures.

As we approach the E-Learning Days for your child, know that we are committed to providing your child with the best education possible through this new journey. You can expect this type of learning through April 16th. If we find out additional information on school closure, we will get that information out ASAP.
The E-Learning will launch on Thursday, 3.26.20, and will run M-TH through April 16th. Students will be able to reach out to their teacher remotely following this schedule:
8:00 am -10:00 am Language Arts, Math
10:00 am - 12:00 pm Social Studies, Science
12:00 pm - 2:00 pm Electives
2:00 - 4:00 pm All Teachers

Teachers will be reaching out to their students on a daily basis to check on academic progress and answer student questions. Advisory teachers will also be reaching out on a weekly basis to check in on academic, technology, physical and any social emotional concerns that students may have. We are attempting to keep things as normal as possible by making sure that daily contact is made. Teachers will still be giving 2 grades per week.

Academics are our main priority at this point but here is some additional information on other activities. Sport practices and events are cancelled through April 18th. Any activities that were scheduled through April 18th are cancelled at this point – to be rescheduled, if possible. Again – this is going to be a journey that we have to work together on and I feel confident that our staff and students will rise to the occasion to meet the challenges of the task ahead.

Thank you in advance for encouraging your child to stay engaged with his/her work so that credits can still be awarded. There is a possibility that if your child does not do the work, he/she could be required to attend school in June to make up for the time that was missed because of not completing work.

Rest assured that if school is closed for an extended period of time, efforts will be given to address the end of year activities – graduation, 8th grade promotion, etc. – in a meaningful way. The office is open from 8-4 M-TH if you have questions – 254.7431. You can also email me at cindy.cowan@rockyford.k12.co.us
Go Meloneers!

p.span: Ahora que acercamos a los días de E-learning de sus hijos, queremos que sepan que estamos comprometidos a proveer a sus hijos con una educación tan mejor como sea posible por esta jornada. Pueden esperar esta clase de aprendizaje por el 16 de abril. Si enteramos más información sobre el cierre de escuelas compartiremos todo con ustedes tan pronto como sea posible.

div.p: Comenzaremos E-learning jueves el 26 de marzo, y continuaremos hasta el 16 de abril. Los estudiantes van a poder a ponerse en contacto con sus maestros remotamente en acuerdo con este horario:
8:00 am - 10:00 am Artes y Letras y Matemáticas
10:00 am - 12:00 pm Estudio Social, Ciencias
12:00 pm - 2:00 pm Electivos
2:00 pm - 4:00 pm Todos los maestros

Los maestros van a estar comunicando con sus hijos en una base diaria para revisar su progreso académico y para responder a preguntas. Los maestros de Advisory (la clase consejera) van a estar poniéndose en contacto con sus hijos en una base semanal para revisar cualquier preocupación con lo académico, tecnológico, físico o cualquier situación emocional que pueden tener. Estamos intentando de mantener todo tan normal como sea posible por asegurar que ponemos en contacto diariamente. Los maestros todavía van a poner 2 notas por semana.

Todo lo académico es nuestra prioridad principal a este punto, pero aquí hay información adicional en otras actividades. Prácticas de deportes y eventos están cancelados por abril 18. Cualquier actividad fijada por el 18 de abril está cancelada a este punto-para ser reprogramada, si sea posible. Otra vez, tenemos que trabajar juntos y me siento seguro que nuestro personal de escuela y los estudiantes vamos a estar a la altura de esta situación y todo que tenemos que hacer.

Gracias de antemano por animar a sus hijos a quedarse ocupados con su tarea para recibir los créditos necesarios. Hay una posibilidad que si sus hijos no hagan sus tareas, que tendrán que venir a la escuela durante el mes de junio para recuperar tiempo faltado por no trabajar en sus tareas.

Tener por seguro que si la escuela está cerrada por más tiempo extendido, vamos a considerar las actividades del fin del año-graduación, graduación del octavo grado, etc.-en una manera significativa. La oficina está abierta de las 8 hasta las 4 lunes a jueves si tienen preguntas-254-7431. También pueden darme un mensaje por email a: cindy.cowan@rockyford.k12.co.us.
¡Muchísimas Gracias!

div.p: 20 days ago
Please check frequently for notices and updates
Dear Parents,

We want your child to continue to be successful with Reading for Fun. As you know AR is a way in which to do so. With that in mind we want to ensure that your child can access the Renaissance Learning Website so that they can read and then test on the books. The URL for Renaissance Learning is as follows:

Even though students are able to read and test we will not be giving out any rewards. The AR trip for this year has been cancelled, but I can assure your child that if they have already earned it, I will make it right. I am looking into an alternative reward that can be done locally. I will share more information with you when I am able.

The students need books. As you know with the Stay at Home order Libraries and schools are closed, so the need for books is huge. If you or your friends, neighbors or family members have books that are not being read, our students need them. If you would share them with the kids or even bring them to the Lunch Distribution sites we will get them in the hands of the students.
Sincerely,
Patti Aldea, Principal
Jefferson Intermediate School
AR (lectura acelerada)
Padres

Queremos que su hijo/a siga teniendo éxito con su Lectura por diversión. Como saben, AR es una forma de lograrlo. Con eso en mente, queremos asegurarnos de que su hijo/a pueda acceder al sitio web de Renaissance Learning para que pueda leer y luego tomar exámenes en los libros. La URL para Renaissance Learning es la siguiente: https://hosted20.renlearn.com/704661/ .

A pesar de que los estudiantes pueden leer y tomar exámenes, no daremos ninguna recompensa. El viaje de AR para este año ha sido cancelado, pero puedo asegurarle a su hijo/a que si ya se lo han ganado, haré algunos arreglos. Estoy buscando una recompensa alternativa que se pueda hacer localmente. Compartiré más información con usted cuando pueda.

Los alumnos necesitan libros. Como sabe, con la orden de Permanecer en Casa, las bibliotecas y las escuelas están cerradas, por lo que la necesidad de libros es enorme. Si usted o sus amigos, vecinos o familiares tienen libros que no están leyendo, nuestros estudiantes los necesitan. Si los compartiera con los niños o incluso los llevará a los sitios de Distribución de Almuerzos, los pondremos en manos de los estudiantes.
*Jefferson Intermediate*

Thank you for your patience during this stressful time. We are working as quickly as we can to put together 4 weeks of work for your student. We will be handing out work packets to your student tomorrow, 3/25 from 7 am to 7 pm
3rd and 4th Grade will be in the front of the school.

p.span: 5th and 6th grade will be on the north side of the building where the buses go.

div.p: Please follow the signs. You will be asked to sign that you received the packet. If you have multiple kids in the building, the packets will be sent with the youngest child. We are asking for any library books your child has at home be returned when you pick up your packets. While you are waiting, please honor Social Distancing of 6 feet.
Thank you.
*Escuela Intermedia Jefferson*

Gracias por su paciencia durante este momento estresante. Estamos trabajando lo más rápido posible para reunir 4 semanas de trabajo para su estudiante. Le entregaremos paquetes de trabajo a su estudiante mañana, 3/25 de 7 am a 7 pm.
El 3er y 4to grado estarán por la puerta principal de la escuela..
El 5to y 6to grado estarán en el lado norte del edificio donde va los autobuses.

Por favor, siga las indicaciones. Se le pedirá que firme que recibió el paquete. Si tiene varios niños en el edificio, los paquetes se enviarán con el niño más pequeño. Le pedimos que devuelva todo los libros de la biblioteca que su hijo tenga en casa cuando recoja sus paquetes. Mientras espera, honre la distancia social de 6 pies.
Gracias.

div.p: 12 days ago
Please check frequently for notices and updates

The staff at Washington Primary School misses you very much! Just a reminder: Your child’s next learning packet will be ready for pickup, Thursday, April 16 between 8:00 am and 6:00 pm. Please drive in front of the school building (11th Street) and stop at the grade-level table to pick up your child’s new packet. We prefer that you use the drive-up service but we can accommodate walkers too. Your child’s entire learning packet from the first 4 weeks will be turned in at this same time.
Kindergarten parents, please pick up your child's packet at the north doors - by parent pick up.
First grade parents, please pick up your child's packet at the main doors.
Second grade parents, please pick up your child's packet at the south doors - by the bus benches.

p.span: The staff at Washington Primary School worked hard the last two days to get learning packets together for distribution today. The staff worked staggered schedules, observed social distancing requirements, and followed safe handling and hand washing procedures.

div.p: Washington Primary School Parents and Guardians - Thank you for your patience. Your child's learning packet will be ready for pickup on Wednesday, March 25 between 7:00 am and 7:00 pm.
Kindergarten parents, please pick up your child's packet at the north doors - by parent pick up.
First grade parents, please pick up your child's packet at the main doors.
Second grade parents, please pick up your child's packet at the south doors - by the bus benches.
If you have children in more than one grade, come to the main doors for all packets. As you are waiting, please honor the social distancing of 6 feet.
Thank you

Padres y tutores de la Escuelas Primaria de Washington, gracias por su paciencia. El paquete de aprendizaje de su hijo estará listo para ser recogido mañana, miércoles 25 de marzo entre las 7:00 am y 7:00 pm.
Padres de Kinder, por favor recoja el paquete de su hijo por las puertas localizadas por la calle Pine - donde usualmente recongen a los estudiantes.
Padres de estudiantes de primer año, por favor recojan el paquete de su hijo por las puertas principales.
Padres de secundo grado, por favor recojan el paquete de su hijo por las puertas de alado - donde están las bancas para esperar el autobús escolar.
Si tiene hijos en más de un grado, diríjase a las puertas principales para recibir todos los paquetes. Mientras espera, por favor honre el distanciamiento social de 6 pies.
Gracias.

div.p: 26 days ago

div.span: The School Board meeting scheduled for Tuesday, April 7, 2020 at 7 pm is cancelled.

div.p: Rocky Ford Schools will be closed starting Monday, March 23, through Friday, April 17, due to the current health crisis. During this extended closure, regular classes will be replaced with learning activities that can be done from home through e-learning or other remote learning strategies. The district will need some time to prepare these learning activities and to make plans on how to share them with students and parents. Therefore, please continue to watch for communication from the school district for instructions and details on when the e-learning activities will start. We anticipate that the e-learning activities will be ready by Wednesday or Thursday of next week (March 25 or 26). Please stay tuned for further details about school and the food service program. Several announcements will be shared in the coming days.

Las Escuelas Rocky Ford estarán cerradas desde el lunes 23 de marzo hasta el viernes 17 de abril, debido a la crisis de salud. Durante este tiempo, las clases regulares serán reemplazadas por actividades de aprendizaje que se pueden realizar desde casa a través del aprendizaje electrónico u otras estrategias de aprendizaje remoto. El distrito necesitará algo de tiempo para preparar estas actividades de aprendizaje y hacer planes sobre cómo compartirlas con los estudiantes y los padres. Por lo tanto, continúe atento a la comunicación del distrito escolar para obtener instrucciones y detalles sobre cuándo comenzarán las actividades de aprendizaje electrónico. Anticipamos que las actividades de e-learning estarán listas para el miércoles o jueves de la próxima semana (25 o 26 de marzo). Estén atentos para más detalles sobre la escuela y el programa de servicio de alimentos. Se compartirán varios anuncios en los próximos días.

p.a: Website Hosting Solution Powered by SchoolBlocks

div.h3:
Welcome to the SchoolBlocks
self-guided tour!
div.p: The most common question we receive is, how is SchoolBlocks inspired by Pinterest? SchoolBlocks eliminates navigation bars and uses a block style layout that’s similar to Pinterest. It creates a unique and engaging browsing experience, optimizes for mobile and removes a lot of navigational complexity.
Please click on the red plus signs found on this page to learn more about specific features.
As an administrator, you will have the custom page editing tools auto-load. Just click ‘read more’ to access our advanced page editing tools.
This bar holds all content types. Click on the Admin button, click "add block", select a content type, add your content then insert the block into the page.
This icon appears when you have edit permissions. Hold your mouse down and move the block. You’ll see the page reorganize!
Each block type has a custom editing experience. Click the pencil on any block or view our help documentation to learn more about block types.
